file_content.text: The resistance forces responsible for the raids against our Troida convoys are encamped in a series of caves nearby.
Reconnaissance teams have finally pinpointed the location of this resistance encampment. Given your extensive abilities, you could eliminate this threat once and for all.
I look forward to making the resistance pay for their transgressions.
Gladly.
You can always count on me for a bit of destruction, Lieutenant.
Gladly.
As long as you keep paying, I'll keep fighting.
Count me in.
Oh, yes! Gladly, gladly. Whatever it takes.
If this camp is a threat to the Empire's interests, then I will neutralize it.
Understood.
I'm afraid I have other matters to attend to now, Lieutenant.
I don't think so.
Please, this is our chance to finally put an end to the attacks on Troida's--and, of course, the Empire's--valuable resources!
You are uniquely qualified to complete this assignment. Are you certain that you cannot participate?
I will help you destroy this resistance encampment, Lieutenant.
No, I can do it.
Oh, good. What a relief. Thank you very much.
The mission will have two primary objectives. Objective one is to eliminate resistance forces and defensive emplacements in the area.
The second objective is to retrieve a set of stolen Imperial power regulators that the resistance is using and destroy their main generator.
The resistance will be punished for their crimes, and the Empire will have its stolen property returned.
Very well.
No more power, no more defenses.
Very well.
Just out of curiosity, what's the street value on those power regulators?
How much are the parts worth?
You are unlikely to find anyone interested in the power regulators outside of the resistance and ourselves. I assure you, we can pay better.
I'll proceed to the objective area immediately, Lieutenant.
Understood.
We will await your return. Good luck.
You'll have to deal with this yourself, Lieutenant.
I'm certain. [Refuse quest]
Understood. Thank you for your service to the Empire. Larbec out.
Thank you for your assistance.
You've returned from your mission against the resistance raiders. Excellent.
Was it a success? Did you drive out that thieving scum once and for all? Will Troida's convoys be safe now?
The resistance shouldn't give your convoys any more trouble.
It's done.
I wouldn't be here if I hadn't succeeded.
Do you even need to ask?
That's such a relief to hear. Thank you.
They've been wiped out.
Total annihilation of enemy forces? I'll make the necessary reports.
I see that you were also successful in retrieving the stolen power regulators. Please, allow me.
What of the enemy generator? Were you able to destroy it as planned?
The generator has been destroyed.
Yes.
Some refugees were using the generator, too. But I destroyed it.
A woman tried to stop me.
Interesting. I'll be sure to have this group investigated.
Do you really need to waste my time with more questions, Lieutenant?
Does it matter?
Er, no. I suppose not.
Are you questioning me, Lieutenant?
Mind who you're speaking to.
I--no. No, your assistance to us in this matter has been invaluable.
I moved through the hideout in a destructive haze. It's difficult to say what happened, exactly.
It was hard to tell.
Oh, well, I'm sure there can be no question of your success, my lord.
There's not a living resistance fighter anywhere near that place now. Job's done.
What's it matter?
Hmm. I suppose you are correct.
The generator will be of no use to the enemy, Lieutenant.
Your concerns are dealt with.
That will be sufficient then, agent.
Refugees were in need of power, Lieutenant. I saw no reason to deny them.
No, I didn't destroy it.
I... see. I suppose, so long as the generator is not in resistance control, there's no cause for concern.
The generator has been disabled, Lieutenant.
[Lie] Yes, I destroyed it.
Excellent. I'll be sure to note it in my report.
There is nothing further. The Empire's interests in this sector will see marked improvement thanks to your actions. Good day.
The resistance encampment is heavily fortified. Proceed with caution.
We were pleased to hear that the convoy arrived safely. Congratulations.
Enemy contact during your mission is highly likely. Good luck.
Convoys traveling to the Troida Military Workshop require armed escorts, and escort personnel are not available at this time.
So, you're telling me we've got your whole blasted Empire behind us, and you can't even find a--
Oh! Forgive me, my lord. I didn't mean... I mean, clearly, the Empire's might is simply, uh, directed elsewhere. Yes. Glory to the Emperor!
There! You see, Lieutenant, a mercenary! You are a mercenary, aren't you? You'd be interested in some well-paid escort work, I'll bet?
Your lack of respect for our glorious Empire troubles me.
I don't like your attitude.
My lord! I... I meant no disrespect. Obviously, our mighty Empire has more important tasks to deal with.
That's no way to ask for help. This is a professional, be courteous!
You aren't being very polite.
My lord! I... yes, yes of course, whatever you say!
I'm a bounty hunter, pal, not just some hired gun.
I'm not just a mercenary.
Burkan forgets himself. But arrangements for employment could be made, if you're interested.
Are you suggesting that the Empire's forces are insufficient?
I don't like your attitude.
Agent! I... no, no, of course not! The Empire's might is considerable! I'm sure that there are simply more, uh, urgent tasks at hand.
Count me in.
Your assistance would be greatly appreciated.
I'll hear you out--for now.
Oh! Sir! I, uh... I didn't mean... obviously, the might of the Empire is focused on more urgent, uh, activities. Yes. Glory to the Empire!
Don't give me a reason to doubt your loyalty.
Mind your words.
Of course not, my lord. I'm very sorry.
Please, please! Don't hesitate--I would love to know how you truly feel.
Speak your mind.
What? I, uh... that is how I truly feel. I'm only frustrated that my factory may soon be unable to contribute its share to our glorious Empire.
That's pretty impressive--standing up so straight when you clearly have no spine.
Coward.
Burkan forgets himself. Unnecessary and useless frustration has clouded his judgment.
It's always a pleasure to encounter such fervent patriotism.
Indeed.
I, uh, I'm glad you approve, agent.
Burkan's frustration is understandable, though misdirected.
What's this all about?
Spare me your groveling and explain the situation.
Get to the point.
The Troida Military Workshop requires fresh supplies for its wartime operations. Supplies are shipped from here by dewback convoy.
But no escort personnel are available. Without an escort, the convoy will not make its delivery.
I can ensure that the supplies make it there intact.
I'll escort the convoy.
All right, sounds easy enough.
Excellent. Burkan, arrange for the equipment and replacement parts to be loaded onto dewbacks immediately.
But... but what about the medical supplies? The wounded workers--if they don't get the supplies soon, they'll die!
Negative. Medical supplies are secondary to mission-critical assets. Adding them will only slow the convoy and expose it to further enemy fire.
Speed won't be a problem. Put everything that's needed into the convoy.
Add the medical supplies, too.
As you wish. I'll have the medical supplies added to the convoy manifest.
I want that convoy moving as fast as possible. Another convoy can carry the medical supplies later.
Only load what's necessary.
Agreed--there's no room for unnecessary risks. Mission-critical items only.
I won't do it. [Refuse quest]
Thank you for your time. We will determine an alternate solution.
Good day to you.
Good day to you.
The convoy will be prepped and ready for transit to the Troida workshop immediately. You only need to protect the dewbacks--a Troida employee will keep them moving. Good luck.
We'll have the dewbacks loaded and ready for transit to the Troida workshop at once. A Troida employee will manage the beasts--you need only defend them. Good luck.
Sure, why not?
You've changed my mind.
Time for some blood.
After this, no more favors.
